    • Method Detail

      • setIsolatedDiskCacheRootPath

        @Deprecated
public static boolean setIsolatedDiskCacheRootPath(java.lang.String path,
                                                               java.lang.String intentAction)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.13. This method will be replaced with new one once shared map service feature is removed.
        Method to allow switching of the disk cache to a separate service process and disk cache path.

        The method must be called before the init() methods on MapEngine.

        The intent (second parameter) must be unique for the client application and must match the definition of the service in AndroidManifest.xml.

        Parameters:
        path - A string containing the new disk cache path.
        intentAction - A string containing "IntentAction" for the isolated service; must be unique for the client application.
        Returns:
        false if path matches default disk cache path or path is a file or invalid or is not writable or intentAction matches default service connection name, otherwise true. When this method has returned false, the MapEngine will remain in shared disk cache mode and expect to find the shared map service. An error code OnEngineInitListener.Error.MISSING_SERVICE will be returned if MapEngine initialization is attempted afterwards.
        See Also:
        DiskCacheUtility
        Note:
        The disk cache path should NOT be set to a place where it can be easily removed or tampered with such as Android application cache folder. Instead, the disk cache path should be set to where files can be persistent., After the MapEngine is successfully initialized, removal or tampering of the disk cache path folder and its content is not supported and detrimental to the operation of the MapEngine while it is running., This method prevents sharing of the disk cache with other clients using the SDK., The behavior is undefined if the disk cache location is used by another application., DiskCacheUtility.migrate(String, String) could be called before MapEngine init for reusing disk cache from previous SDK version.
